results.title: Frontline
results.creator_credit: David Bradbury, Australian War Memorial, Tasmanian Film Corporation, Australian Film Commission, British Broadcasting Corporation and ABC
results.brief_description:
An account of the Vietnam War as seen through the camera of the late Australian war correspondent, Neil Davis. David Bradbury’s multi-award winning documentary also examines the ethical issues facing a man in the frontline who is not an active combatant.
Vietnam was a television war, a war said to have been lost in the lounge rooms of middle America, and not on the battlefield. This film explores the conflict, and Davis’ involvement in it, combining his original footage, comments and archival film. It includes the famous, historic footage of the fall of Saigon, which Davis was the only Western journalist to film.

Warning: some scenes may disturb.

results.title: Voices of Malaya
results.creator_credit: Terry Trench, Ralth Eaton, Colonial Office and Central Office of Information
results.brief_description: Voices of Malaya was made before hostilities in Malaya began, in the period immediately after World War 2. It is primarily a background study of the problems facing a country with a population of five million people - Malayan, Chinese-Malayan, Indian-Malayan and European - who are suffering from the aftermath of war. It shows the efforts of the mixed nationalities of Malaya working and living together in the best interests of their country. Music by Elizabeth Lutyens, played by The Philharmonic Orchestra and conducted by John Hollingsworth.

results.title: Royal visit to Melbourne 1963
results.creator_credit: H. Rodney Power, David Swift and State Film Centre of Victoria
results.brief_description: Colour film record of the visit to Melbourne of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II and His Royal Highness the Duke of Edinburgh. The three crowded, exciting days are show in detail. Includes the arrival of Her Majesty, presentation of the cup at the races at Flemington, a glittering State reception, service at Scot’s Church, Myer Music Bowl concert, Moomba parade, waving to country children en route to open the Royal Children’s Hospital, investiture at Government House, and farewell at the wharf.

results.title: The Challenge
results.creator_credit: Jack Rogers, Frank Killian and Ampol Petroleum Ltd
results.brief_description: This is a tribute to the Australians who sailed Gretel” in the America’s Cup…” Traces the construction of the Australian challenger, “Gretel”, its trials in America, and finally its efforts in the America’s Cup yacht races.

results.title: Cave temples of India
results.creator_credit: Jagat Murari, M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: A vivid reminder of a great past when people created miracles in stone to express devotion to their gods. Shows some of the famous rock-cut shrines, including the caves at Badami, Elephanta and Ellora, dating from the 17th century. Explains the statues depicting the various incarnations of the Hindu deity. Commentary by Berkeley Hill.

results.title: Special Project no. 14: Marlo-Mallacoota-Cape Conran
results.brief_description: The Country Roads Board’s Project no. 14 involves the building of a road from Orbost to Marlo. Shows the first section to Cape Conran and difficulties encountered in clearing and leveling the sandy loam. The area opened by the road has great development potential in its attractive surf beaches, bushland and off-shore oil drilling. Photography by Jim Stirling.

results.title: The Burnie story
results.creator_credit: Associated Pulp and Paper Manufacturers and Cine Service
results.brief_description: The township of Burnie on the north-west coast of Tasmania with a population of 14,000 is the centre of the thriving pulp and paper manufacturing industry. This industry started in 1936 and produces from the forests in the surrounding country, not only timber for the building industry but from the timber waste all types of cardboard, and wrapping paper and even high-grade printing paper. The film shows the up-to-date and powerful machinery which is used from the time a tree is felled until the final paper product is shipped from the Burnie wharves. Afforestation is maintained to ensure the raw material will not be exhausted. Photography: Geoffrey Thompson. Narrated by Ray Chapman.

results.title: 11 Steps to Survival
results.creator_credit: Pierre L'Amare, Robert Verrall and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film demonstrating steps to take in the event of a nuclear attack. Animated drawings show the effects of atomic explosions in the air and at ground level. How wide an area is affected by light and heat flash, radiation and radio-active fall-out is clearly illustrated. How to build or improvise a fall-out shelter, what to stock in it, when to take shelter and how long to stay there are similarly explained.

results.title: Grand Steeple Chase de Paris 1922
results.brief_description:
The John Robertson Duigan Collection is a collection of silent 9.5mm home movies filmed by early aviator and engineer John Robertson Duigan (1882–1951). The collection includes a Pathé-Baby 9.5mm film camera and projector owned by Duigan. The home movies provide an insight into the everyday lives of John and his family in Victoria, including picnics, trips to the Grampians and Colac, family snapshots and aeroplanes of the late 1920s.

This is a French Pathé Baby film, originally presented on 9.5mm film, ‘Grand Steeple Chase de Paris 1922’ from John Robertson Duigan’s collection.
